CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 9, 1953, pg. 32, reads: "E. L. Smith, Builder, From Blueprint To New Community - New Homes Are News - Few Pittsburgh Negroes have ever had the privilege of living in a new home. Within recent years, E. L. Smith has built more new homes for Negroes than any other local building contractor. Operating principally on the East End - Penn Township sector, he has sparked the emergence of a new community in this area.  Here our photographer has taken pictures of phases of the Smith operation, as he converts raw land into a setting for graceful living. - Harris Photos."  "Small home - The present day vogue is toward smaller, more compact homes. Here is the exterior of one of Mr. Smith built."
TitMainTitle: Two story brick home with two picture windows, at 1416 Oberlin Street, East End
